dict.string: Cite in Markdown and convert Markdown files to .docx, .pdf, .html, or .pptx with proper citations & bibliography
Pandoc-Suite for Citations and Bibliographies in Markdown

on alfred_script(q) if application "Zotero" is not running then display notification "" with title "⏳ Starting Zotero..." subtitle "" tell application "Zotero" to activate delay 2.5 end if return "started Zotero" end alfred_script

-- this script puts the app into foreground that was in focus when the hotkey was triggered. -- this allows the following clipboard action later on to automatically paste the input into the app
on run
set focusedapp_id to (system attribute "focusedapp") tell application id focusedapp_id to activate --note: alfreds focused-app-variable passes not an app name, but the app-id, therefore they keyword "id" has to be added here. return "{query}" --passes through the query
end run

on run
set focusedapp_id to (system attribute "focusedapp") tell application id focusedapp_id to activate --note: alfreds focused-app-variable passes not an app name, but the app-id, therefore they keyword "id" has to be added here.
end run
Will open Pandoc-Suite Guide with explanation

⚠️ You used a command that was valid in Pandoc-Suite 1.x but has become obsolete in the new version 2.0.
Triggering Pandoc has been simplified, please consult the usage guide that has just been opened in the browser.

on alfred_script(q) try tell application "CotEditor" set the_document to front document save the_document set hsf_path to file of the_document end tell end try if (hsf_path = missing value) then return "no_file_recognized" else return POSIX path of hsf_path end if end alfred_script

⚠️ No file was recognized.
This usually only happens when you have created a new document and have not saved it yet. Please save the document and try again.

on alfred_script(q) try tell application "iA Writer" set the_document to front document save the_document set hsf_path to file of the_document end tell end try if (hsf_path = missing value) then return "no_file_recognized" else return POSIX path of hsf_path end if end alfred_script

⚠️ Atom is open, but no file was recognized.
This usually only happens when you have created a new document and have not saved it yet. Please save the document and try again.

on alfred_script(q)
tell application "Atom" to activate tell application "System Events" to keystroke "s" using {command down} --workaround to save tell application "System Events" to tell process "Atom" set atomPath to name of window 1 end tell return atomPath
end alfred_script

⚠️ The selected file does not seem to be a Markdown file. Please select a markdown file and try again.
'{query}'

on alfred_script(q)
tell application "Finder" to set sel to selection if ((count sel) > 1) then set firstItem to item 1 of sel return POSIX path of (firstItem as text) else return POSIX path of (sel as text) end if
end alfred_script

# THESE VARIABLES MUST BE SET. SEE THE ONEUPDATER README FOR AN EXPLANATION OF EACH. readonly remote_info_plist='https://raw.githubusercontent.com/chrisgrieser/pandoc_alfred/main/info.plist' readonly workflow_url='chrisgrieser/pandoc_alfred' readonly download_type='github_release' readonly frequency_check='1'
# FROM HERE ON, CODE SHOULD BE LEFT UNTOUCHED! function abort { echo "${1}" >&2 exit 1 }
function url_exists { curl --silent --location --output /dev/null --fail --range 0-0 "${1}" }
function notification { local -r notificator="$(find . -type d -name 'Notificator.app')" if [[ -n "${notificator}" ]]; then "${notificator}/Contents/Resources/Scripts/notificator" --message "${1}" --title "${alfred_workflow_name}" --subtitle 'A new version is available' return fi
local -r terminal_notifier="$(find . -type f -name 'terminal-notifier')" if [[ -n "${terminal_notifier}" ]]; then "${terminal_notifier}" -title "${alfred_workflow_name}" -subtitle 'A new version is available' -message "${1}" return fi
osascript -e "display notification \"${1}\" with title \"${alfred_workflow_name}\" subtitle \"A new version is available\"" }
# Local sanity checks readonly local_info_plist='info.plist' readonly local_version="$(/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'print version' "${local_info_plist}")"
[[ -n "${local_version}" ]] || abort 'You need to set a workflow version in the configuration sheet.' [[ "${download_type}" =~ ^(direct|page|github_release)$ ]] || abort "'download_type' (${download_type}) needs to be one of 'direct', 'page', or 'github_release'." [[ "${frequency_check}" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]] || abort "'frequency_check' (${frequency_check}) needs to be a number."
# Check for updates if [[ $(find "${local_info_plist}" -mtime +"${frequency_check}"d) ]]; then if ! url_exists "${remote_info_plist}"; then abort "'remote_info_plist' (${remote_info_plist}) appears to not be reachable."; fi # Remote sanity check
readonly tmp_file="$(mktemp)" curl --silent --location --output "${tmp_file}" "${remote_info_plist}" readonly remote_version="$(/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'print version' "${tmp_file}")"
if [[ "${local_version}" == "${remote_version}" ]]; then touch "${local_info_plist}" # Reset timer by touching local file exit 0 fi
if [[ "${download_type}" == 'page' ]]; then notification 'Opening download page…' open "${workflow_url}" exit 0 fi
download_url="$([[ "${download_type}" == 'github_release' ]] && curl --silent "https://api.github.com/repos/${workflow_url}/releases/latest" | grep 'browser_download_url' | head -1 | sed -E 's/.*browser_download_url": "(.*)"/\1/' || echo "${workflow_url}")"
if url_exists "${download_url}"; then notification 'Downloading and installing…' curl --silent --location --output "${HOME}/Downloads/${alfred_workflow_name}.alfredworkflow" "${download_url}" open "${HOME}/Downloads/${alfred_workflow_name}.alfredworkflow" else abort "'workflow_url' (${download_url}) appears to not be reachable." fi fi

⚠️ No PDF Engine set.
You have to set a PDF engine before using "pdf" as output format. You can do that by triggering Alfred, typing "pconf", and selecting "PDF-Engine".

⚠️ You have not selected a BibTex-Library.
You can do that by triggering Alfred, typing "pconf", and selecting "BibTeX Library".

--pandoc command construction
on run
--import major variables (Shell Script part necessary to handle encoding, see https://www.alfredforum.com/topic/15992-applescript-reads-alfred-environment-variables-in-wrong-encoding/ set csl_file to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "csl_file") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN" set bibtex_library_path to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "bibtex_library_path") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN" set reference_docx_path to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "reference_docx_path") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN" set reference_pptx_path to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "reference_pptx_path") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN" set further_pandoc_args to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "further_pandoc_args") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN" set pdf_engine to (system attribute "pdf_engine") (*these omit the shell script detour as they will only have preset values*) set desired_format to (system attribute "desired_format") set slide_level to (system attribute "slide_level")
--split doc_path into parent_folder and doc_name set doc_path to "{query}"
set doc_name to doc_path repeat while (offset of "/" in doc_name) > 0 --loop checks whether a Slash is still in the string set doc_name to text ((offset of "/" in doc_name) + 1) thru -1 of doc_name end repeat
set parent_folder to text 1 thru -(1 + (length of doc_name)) of doc_path
--removes common Markdown file extensions from the doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".md" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".mdtxt" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".markdown" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".Rmd" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".mkd" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".mdwn" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".mdown" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".txt" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name
-- building the pandoc command set bibliography to "" set reference_docx to "" set pdf_arg to "" set reference_pptx to ""
set input to (quoted form of doc_path) & " " set output to "-o " & (quoted form of (parent_folder & doc_name & "." & desired_format)) & " " set resource_path to "--resource-path=" & (quoted form of parent_folder) & " " if bibtex_library_path ≠ "" then set bibliography to "--bibliography " & (quoted form of bibtex_library_path) & " " set citation_style_path to "--csl ~" & (quoted form of ("/Zotero/styles/" & csl_file)) & " " set slide_level_arg to "--slide-level=" & slide_level & " " set further_args to further_pandoc_args & " " if reference_docx_path ≠ "" then set reference_docx to "--reference-doc " & (quoted form of reference_docx_path) & " " if reference_pptx_path ≠ "" then set reference_pptx to "--reference-doc " & (quoted form of reference_pptx_path) & " " if pdf_engine ≠ "" then set pdf_arg to "--pdf-engine=" & pdf_engine & " "
-- modifies command based on desired output format. set pandoc_command to ("pandoc " & input & output & "--citeproc " & resource_path & bibliography & citation_style_path & further_args) if desired_format = "docx" then set pandoc_command to (pandoc_command & reference_docx) if desired_format = "pdf" then set pandoc_command to (pandoc_command & pdf_arg) if desired_format = "html" then set pandoc_command to (pandoc_command & "--standalone ") if desired_format = "pptx" then set pandoc_command to (pandoc_command & reference_pptx & slide_level_arg) set pandoc_command to (pandoc_command & " 2>&1")
-- returns the pandoc-command to Alfred, to process it as bash script return pandoc_command end run

[{"title":"🚪 Exit this Configuration","arg":"exit"},{"title":"ℹ️ Documentation & Guide for the Pandoc Suite","arg":"workflow_documentation","subtitle":"visit for troubleshooting and further information"},{"title":"📚 BibTeX Library","arg":"bibtex_lib","subtitle":"currently: {var:bibtex_library_path}"},{"title":"✍️ Citation Style","arg":"set_csl","subtitle":"currently: {var:csl_file}"},{"title":"⌨️ Hotkey Output Format","arg":"hotkey_format","subtitle":"currently: {var:hotkey_output_format}"},{"title":"⬇️ Install New Citation Style","arg":"install_csl","subtitle":"via Zotero's Style Repository"},{"title":"📄 Word Reference Document","arg":"reference_docx","subtitle":"currently: {var:reference_docx_path}"},{"title":"🏎 PDF-Engine","arg":"pdf_engine","subtitle":"currently: {var:pdf_engine}"},{"title":"🧑‍🏫 Powerpoint Reference Presentation","arg":"reference_pptx","subtitle":"currently: {var:reference_pptx_path}"},{"title":"📊 Slide Level for Presentations","arg":"slide_level","subtitle":"currently: {var:slide_level}"},{"title":"❗️ Further Arguments","arg":"further_args","subtitle":"currently: {var:further_pandoc_args}"}]

on run
tell application "Alfred" set configuration "hotkey_output_format" to value "{query}" in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" with exportable end tell
return "{query}"
end run
Sets the Output Format for the Hotkey

on run
set chosen_csl_path to "{query}" (* Alfred input*)
-- removes file path set chosen_csl to chosen_csl_path repeat while (offset of "/" in chosen_csl) > 0 set chosen_csl to text ((offset of "/" in chosen_csl) +1) thru - 1 of chosen_csl end repeat
-- sets file-name as csl_file in global variable tell application "Alfred" set configuration "csl_file" to value chosen_csl in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" with exportable end tell
-- Returns without extension for the Alfred notification set chosen_csl_no_ext to text 1 thru -5 of chosen_csl return chosen_csl_no_ext
end run
Alternatively, press [space] to list all installed Citation Styles.

Please choose a Citation Style here. Clicking a link will prompt Zotero to install the Style.
Afterwards, you can set the citation style.

on run
--sets Alfred Environment Variable tell application "Alfred" set configuration "reference_docx_path" to value "{query}" in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" end tell
-- removes file path for Notification set docx_file_name to "{query}" repeat while (offset of "/" in docx_file_name) > 0 set docx_file_name to text ((offset of "/" in docx_file_name) +1) thru - 1 of docx_file_name end repeat return docx_file_name
end run
Press [space] to view a list of the last modified .docx Files.

on run
--sets Alfred Environment Variable tell application "Alfred" set configuration "reference_pptx_path" to value "{query}" in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" end tell
-- removes file path for Notification set pptx_file_name to "{query}" repeat while (offset of "/" in pptx_file_name) > 0 set pptx_file_name to text ((offset of "/" in pptx_file_name) +1) thru - 1 of pptx_file_name end repeat return pptx_file_name
end run
Press [space] to view a list of recently modified .pptx Files.

on run
tell application "Alfred" set configuration "pdf_engine" to value "{query}" in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" end tell
return "{query}"
end run
ATTENTION: This command only selects a PDF-Engine, is does NOT install it.
Set additional options for the Pandoc Command

on run
tell application "Alfred" set configuration "further_pandoc_args" to value "{query}" in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" with exportable end tell
return "{query}"
end run

on run
--sets Alfred Environment Variable tell application "Alfred" set configuration "bibtex_library_path" to value "{query}" in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" end tell
-- removes file path for Notificattion set bibtex_library_path to "{query}" repeat while (offset of "/" in bibtex_library_path) > 0 set bibtex_library_path to text ((offset of "/" in bibtex_library_path) +1) thru - 1 of bibtex_library_path end repeat return bibtex_library_path
end run
If no file is listed, make sure you have changed the file extension to ".bibtex"
Search for BibTeX Library for your Bibliography...

on run
tell application "Alfred" set configuration "slide_level" to value "{query}" in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" with exportable end tell
return "{query}"
end run

[{"title":"Slide-Level 1","arg":"1","subtitle":"H1 will be used as slide titles"},{"title":"Slide-Level 2","arg":"2","subtitle":"H2 will be used as slide titles"},{"title":"Slide-Level 3","arg":"3","subtitle":"H3 will be used as slide titles"},{"title":"Slide-Level 4","arg":"4","subtitle":"H4 will be used as slide titles"},{"title":"Consult Pandoc Manual on Slide Levels & Slide Structure","arg":"pandoc_website","subtitle":"https:\/\/pandoc.org\/MANUAL.html#structuring-the-slide-show"}]
Set the Slide-Level for Conversions to Powerpoint
H{query} will now be used for slide titles.

PLEASE READ IF YOU PREVIOUSLY USED PANDOC VERSION 1.x =====================================================
With version 2.0, the way the Pandoc-Suite has been vastly reworked. Please consult the guide how to use the Pandoc-Suite now. Do not worry – the changes have been made to greatly simplify use, especially for Alfred newcomers.
See information here: https://www.notion.so/chrisgrieser/Pandoc-Suite-for-Citations-and-Bibliographies-in-Markdown-4de4bd634ceb4533a1add8b105a487b1#6067e5b7a65448c195b602fb413068b0
The Documentation and Usage Guide has also been expanded with more detailed explanations and troubleshooting.
Documentation & Usage Guide: https://chris-grieser.de/pandoc_alfred
Release Notes ============= 2.7 - Zotero stays in the background when triggering the Citation Picker - properly starts Zotero before displaying the picker
2.6 - refactoring and other internal improvements - minor corrections in spelling
2.5 - better visualizations of notifications and messages, and the pconf-menu
2.4 - bugfix with iA Writer file recognition - support for file recognition from CotEditor - prevents running of non-Markdown files when in texteditors
2.3.2 - minor bug fix with pconf
2.3.1 - fixed yet another problem with Alfred finding .bib files. Seriously Alfred devs, I love you, but why are you making this so hard?
2.3 - when an error is encountered during the pandoc conversion (typically missing citations), an error log file is created and saved at the same location of the output
2.2.1 - fixed a bug where some latex-based pdf engines are not recognized by Alfred due to missing PATH-inclusion - fixed a bug where bibtex files are sometimes not recognized in the pconf-settings
2.2: - support for Hotkey use in Atom [they offer a plugin for Markdown](https://atom.io/packages/language-markdown). - uses "~" instead of the home directory in the pconf-settings, to make life easier for people saving their data in the cloud. - additional error messages when necessary settings have not been made
2.1 - improved info on PDF engines - improved documentation - loop for pconf to make the configuration of multiple settings easier
2.0 - due to popular request, changed the trigger of this workflow: the hotkey now also works for files selected in Finder, an option most convenient for people not familiar with Alfred. - other than that, it is now also possible to trigger Pandoc via file action.
1.3.1 - Because of the deprecation of pandoc-citeproc and its substitution with --citeproc (which was implemented in v 1.2.1 of this workflow), style folders can be set automatically. This means installation of this workflow for new users is simplified.
v 1.3 - enables automatic updates via OneUpdater (https://github.com/vitorgalvao/alfred-workflows/tree/master/OneUpdater) and some minor refactoring of the pconf-command
v 1.2.1 - fix: uses "--citeproc" as parameter due to the deprecation of pandoc-citeproc with pandoc version 2.11 (fixes this workflow for people installing pandoc after November 2020)
v 1.2 - conversion to Powerpoint and the addition of the respective settings
v 1.1 - changed default hotkeys for higher compatibility - added support for images while converting (with the --resource-path parameter)

GREEN HOTKEY: Double-click to define
Triggers Pandoc Conversion

RED HOTKEY: Double-click to configure
Citation Picker
Configuration of PanDoc Parameters (= settings of this workflow)
saves path for revealing in Finder
if Zotero is not running, start it
